page.title: 17FARMING IN GILMORTON AREA
page.content: This is an account written by a local farmer. We farm 65 acres of land.We do not grow any arable crops,the land being all down to grass which is permanent pasture,only being ploughed up if worn out.The main enterprise is milking for which we keep about 50 British Fresian cows.We usually rear about 20 beef cattle which are sold as Stores at 18 months old.We buy ewes in September/ October to utilise surplus grass and tidy up the fields over winter. These are sold with their lambs in April/ May. We make hay for winter fodder. This summer we have made big bale silage for the first time. The farm is managed by my wife and me with no outside labour being employed. My wife keeps a herd of goats as a hobby. We also have a shire horse which we try to work.
